intro: Centropogon hazenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame grass, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers that bloom in dense, showy clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of the Hawaiian archipelago. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a distinctive silver-blue hue on the underside. Centropogon hazenii is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in dry, sandy soils.
